It ends up looking like The first Saturday Night of the World, depicting creatures of all shapes and sizes dancing in the dark with Adam in the center. Pencil on graph paper, photocopied and colored with felt-tip marker.
[detail] A Branching pattern. Coloring inspired by the chromatic depiction of the 2000 Presidential Electoral Map. Pencil on graph paper, photocopied and colored with felt-tip marker.

[detail] I was executing the line pattern for this one in AutoCAD, got a strange feeling, turned it upside-down and thought to myself, "I think this one is done", because it had turned out looking like a skull. I ported it into Coreldraw and colored it appropriately. Looking at the last date the file was modified, it is interesting to note that I finished this one about a month before September 11th.

[detail] Branching pattern with closing ends; the resulting polygons are "onionized" and colored adjacently according to an arbitrary spectrum. It ends up looking very maritime indeed. Pattern drawn in AutoCAD, printed and colored with felt-tip marker.

This one has the name it does because it was the first work of mine where I completely used my computer to draw the lines. The lines were done in AutoCAD, then it was printed out and colored with felt-tip marker.

One day I finally thought to put dates on my sketch pages, and this is one of the images on the page dated December 1st. It's one of a large series of sketches in which the design is determined by a genetic code based on the letters of a word. In this case, this pattern is based on the short version of my first name. It was done with pencil on Engineering graph paper.
